Soil quality: The soil in your backyard may not be ideal for gardening. It may be too sandy, too clay-heavy, or have poor drainage, which can affect the health and productivity of your plants.
Sunlight: If your backyard doesn't get enough sunlight, it can be difficult to grow certain types of plants or maintain a healthy garden.
Watering: If you live in an area with inconsistent weather patterns, it can be challenging to provide the right amount of water for your plants.
Pests and diseases: Garden pests and diseases can damage your plants and affect their health, reducing the yield of your harvest.
Weeds: Weeds can compete with your plants for water, nutrients, and sunlight, and can also spread diseases or pests.
